prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Central Virginia Primetimers records, M 353, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Central Virginia Primetimers in January 2006.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Central Virginia Primetimers are the Richmond-area branch of the Primetimers World Wide, an organization formed in December 2002 to provide mature gay and bisexual men, and their admirers, with opportunities to come together in a supportive atmosphere to enjoy social, educational, and recreational activities.

Primetimers World Wide was founded in 1987 by a retired professor, Woody Baldwin. He felt a wide gap existed in today's society which caters almost exclusively to youth. Baldwin began the Boston Chapter first, but the organization has grown to include over sixty chapters worldwide, located throughout North America, Europe and Australia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection principally consisting of board of directors minutes, newsletters, and officers' election ballots for the organization. Also included are magazine articles, funeral programs, and website printouts related to specific members.

did.unittitle: Richmond Magazine - Article on Rick Smith and Gary Vaughan, 2004
